title: [Large-Scale] Experiential Learning and Mentoring Programs for Strengthening Practical Management Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational business administration concepts and relevant work experience
context.additional_context: Learners are ordinary citizens with practical industry experience across sectors, aiming to bridge the gap between management theory and practice

learning_goals: Learners can secure data-driven decision-making capabilities by analyzing real-world business cases.

Learners will collaborate with two peers and one mentor to define a public project (e.g., solving community issues) within two weeks, establish at least three solution strategies, and submit an implementation plan (including timelines) to formulate and execute project-based problem-solving strategies

Learners will plan self-directed learning for at least five hours weekly on an online learning platform (LMS) over three weeks, maintain weekly learning journals (goals, execution, outcomes), and submit a final performance report (achieving over 80% of learning objectives) at the courseâ€™s conclusion
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
